title: Disruption (new version)
shortDescription: Disruption will assist payers in assessing the competitiveness of their network to another network using utilization data provided by an employer looking to switch health plans.
body:
Overview 



Disruption will assist payers in assessing the competitiveness of their network to another network using utilization data provided by an employer looking to switch health plans. 



Accessing Disruption 



The Disruption module requires activation by Zelis, on the client, project and user levels. Once this has been completed, Disruption is accessible under Sales Tools in the left column navigation. Depending on your setup, you may see Disruption (new version), Disruption (old version) or both. 



Running a Disruption Analysis 



To perform a Disruption analysis, you will need the following: 



Utilization File  



Uploaded by clients into the Disruption module; it contains data on claims aggregated at the provider, address, and TIN levels. 



Mapping of the utilization file headers to the Zelis standard column names  



Clients will also map the columns that are in the Utilization File to the 

 standard columns of data available in Network360   



Matching configuration  



This is created within the Disruption module of Network360. A Matching Configuration allows you to define the parameters checked during the analysis portion of this process. 



 

Importing a Utilization File 



To import a Utilization file: 



Navigate to Disruption, then click on Utilization Files 



Click on + Import File  



Navigate to the file location to drag and drop the file onto the Upload section OR Click the Upload section to select the file, then click the Open button.  



Note: The maximum file size is 100 mb; the recommended format is .csv
